Posts.Content: Hi there! I have been on Letrozole for about a year and my hair is thinning too!  Every time I shampoo I rinse off enough hair to see it go down the drain.  Like you my scalp is not showing yet but it always makes me cringe.  I tell myself that it's not a big price to pay since Tamoxifen made me miserable and I'm glad to be on Letrozole now.  It is dismaying though.  I don't know what to do or if anything can be done.  I'm convinced that the Letrozole is keeping my stage 4 with bone mets at bay so I'll not complain too much.  Good luck to you and God bless.
Posts.Title: Hair Loss using Letrozole

Posts.Content: Oh, Tamoxifen was so much torture for me!  In 2009 I had both breasts removed and my Onc put me on Tamoxifen.  I took it for 3 years and then quit it because of the side effects.  Every side effect you mentioned was my case.  I developed a huge (and I mean HUGE) fibroid tumor within 4 months of starting the Tamoxifen and had to have a hysterectomy.  My Gyno said it was likely the Tamoxifen but my Onc. said that was ridiculous.  Anyway, it really messed me up.  Had just started a new job and it was so bad I had to quit because I was so unable to learn.  Well, 5 years later my cancer came back so I'm stage 4 with bone mets.  I wish now I'd have made other choices.  Hate hate the way Tamoxifen messed me up!  Now I take the Letrozole and get Xgeva shots once a month.  If Tamoxifen would have kept me cancer free I still don't know if I would have took it.  I have a new Onc. now and he's great.  Told me that even though I didn't make the 5 years on Tamoxifen, it likely wouldn't have made a difference.
Posts.Title: side effects of tamoxifen and arimidex

Posts.Content: Hey there!  I'm sorry you had a bad deal too.  My first Onc. thought I was just complaining.  I really couldn't live any sort of normal life.  Yes, I take Letrozole now that I'm past menses. and the Xgeva is to help with the cancer that went to my bones.  Seems all meds cause side effects...but the hot flashes are soo much better now.  I hope you can find some relief.  btw, my fibroid tumor grew soo fast it was unbelievable...I really do think that the Tamoxifen caused it...the timing and the coincidence was too much not to be.  Sure wish I knew then what I know now, I'd have made some very different choices.  Good luck to you and God bless.

Posts.Content: Hi there- I just ran across your message and felt the need to say something.  Sure hope your Mom is doing better now adays!  I have stage 4 myself and just wanted to tell you that it's OK not to go if your Mother passes...we each deal with death in different ways so don't let anyone give you more grief than you will have.  I don't want my children to see me " one last time".Please lean on Jesus-he will help you.  God bless you and God bless your Mother.  She sounds like she raised a wonderful daughter!
